Header: The minimum fine imposed on seven traffic offences raised to 25,000 rupees
Content: Minimum fine imposed on seven traffic rules violation offences has increased up to 25,000 rupees. Ministry of Transport and Civil Aviation states that the relevant gazette has already been issued. The amended fines will be presented in Parliament and turned to be a law. Accordingly the Act of Motor Vehicle transportation will be updated. The decision to increase the fine was taken by a committee of five experts appointed by the President. The new amendment will be in effect for offences ; driving without a valid driving license, letting people who do not possess a driving license driving, driving vehicles under the influence of alcohol or drugs, entering a vehicle into railway line carelessly, driving an uninsured vehicle, driving flouting speed limits and overtaking vehicles from the left.
